meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: The final version of Windows 8 made its public debut, at long last, at a press event Thursday at Pier 57 in New York City. Appropriate for the touchy-feely nature of the operating system, Microsoft set up a bundle of demo stations around a model city design and let attendees go to town.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SAKi99&via=Digg&text=Hands-On, At Last

div.div: ABILITY TO MAKE 'AUTONOMOUS CHOICES' WORRIES NO ONE

div.a: Humanoid Robot Jumps, Climbs With Athletic Precision

div.div: The robot uses its Gekko-like legs to scale a knee-high ledge and leaps to the floor with a femur-splintering thud before traversing a wall-to-wall hole in a hallway floor.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ThEELO&via=Digg&text=Humanoid Robot Jumps, Climbs With Athletic Precision

div.a: Apple's CEO Swears He Will Never Make A 7-Inch Tablet

div.div: "We don't think they're good products," Cook tells analysts. Because, you see, the iPad Mini is a 7.9-inch tablet.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RLQLOC&via=Digg&text=Apple's CEO Swears He Will Never Make A 7-Inch Tablet

div.div: Amongst the responses student received from the prestigious university's administration after reporting a sexual assault, “Take a year off, get a job at Starbucks, and come back after he’s graduated.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QIiYpU&via=Digg&text=Amherst Severely Mishandles Rape Charge

div.div: Vikings were fighting here in the New World long before the rest of Europe made it across the Atlantic, but how they were fighting is somewhat of a mystery, until now.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RYeABX&via=Digg&text=How Vikings Really Fought

div.a: Segway Inventor Wants To Turn Cable Television Into Clean Energy

div.div: Inventor Dean Kamen is exploring using his new shiny new version of a 19th-century engine to provide clean power to keep your TV on. It’s no Segway, but it just might work.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TIDBR8&via=Digg&text=Segway Inventor Wants To Turn Cable Television Into Clean Energy

div.a: Jailbreaking Now Legal For Smartphones, But Not Tablets

div.div: For the next three years, you'll be allowed to jailbreak smartphones but not tablet computers.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TZsEel&via=Digg&text=Jailbreaking Now Legal For Smartphones, But Not Tablets

div.div: STICK YOUR HAIR IN TO TURN ON THE RIDE

div.a: Leaked ‘Avatar Land’ Blueprints Reveal Possible 3D Simulator And Water Ride

div.div: New rumors have begun circulating that James Cameron has finally signed off on Disney’s plans and things are once again full steam ahead. So what’s in the plans?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Rj60jY&via=Digg&text=Leaked ‘Avatar Land’ Blueprints Reveal Possible 3D Simulator And Water Ride

div.a: For The Ultimate In Travel Luxury, You Have To Turn Pro

div.div: Forget first class. Private jets? Lousy by comparison—too cramped and understaffed. If you want the pinnacle of air travel today, the poshest of the posh, fly with a professional sports team.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RZ6cSS&via=Digg&text=For The Ultimate In Travel Luxury, You Have To Turn Pro

div.a: What's Your Vote Worth This Election?

div.div: President Obama and Mitt Romney are spending a combined $26.86 every second of this election cycle, an amount that the president has called "ridiculous."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PT59YT&via=Digg&text=What's Your Vote Worth This Election?

div.a: The Social Networking Lives Of Dead Celebrities

div.div: Just because a celebrity is dead doesn’t mean he can’t tweet. The people who manage the estates of dead celebrities have realized that if you want to keep your star relevant, it helps to have a social-networking presence.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VDTD6e&via=Digg&text=The Social Networking Lives Of Dead Celebrities

div.a: What Would A Disney-Owned Food Network Look Like?

div.div: It's been reported that Disney may take a controlling stake in the beloved Food Network. So what would the new channel look like?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/R2unyI&via=Digg&text=What Would A Disney-Owned Food Network Look Like?

div.a: 15 Companies Getting Back Into The Businesses They Killed

div.div: That Words With Friends board game is just the tip of the disrupted iceberg.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SkTArJ&via=Digg&text=15 Companies Getting Back Into The Businesses They Killed

div.a: What Makes Us See Jesus In A Taco?

div.div: Photographer Todd Terwilliger calls this picture "Skull Flower," for reasons that should be obvious. Its resemblance to a human cranium is, of course, purely coincidental — yet the urge for our minds to register this plant as a piece of human anatomy is all but impossible to resist. But why?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TYLDpq&via=Digg&text=What Makes Us See Jesus In A Taco?

div.a: Twitter Tells Us The Differences Between Obama And Romney Supporters

div.div: Twitter was the secret sauce that made this election's presidential debates palatable, generating 10 million tweets about the first debate alone, not to mention a circus of memes and the hashtags to entertain jaded viewers. But who are these politically minded tweeps? What can we learn from the vast ocean of public status updates out there?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VrjW9N&via=Digg&text=Twitter Tells Us The Differences Between Obama And Romney Supporters

div.a: How Did A Blogger Buy 1.1 Million Users' Email Addresses For Five Dollars?

div.div: It’s no secret that Facebook treats your personal data as a commodity. But when that data ends up on the open market, you may be surprised at the price it fetches: in this case, less than half a thousandth of a penny.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RYBw46&via=Digg&text=How Did A Blogger Buy 1.1 Million Users' Email Addresses For Five Dollars?

div.div: Underneath Paris is a parallel universe of tunnels, caverns, bones—and party venues.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PQHQyT&via=Digg&text=Exploring Underground Paris

div.div: GOING 2 BRK UP W/ THE SOUTH

div.a: Daniel Day-Lewis Sent Text Messages In Character As Abe Lincoln

div.div: In the summer of 2011, the actress Sally Field began receiving text messages from Abraham Lincoln. Only they weren't really from the long-deceased president, they were from her "Lincoln" co-star, Daniel Day-Lewis.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TYTDXs&via=Digg&text=Daniel Day-Lewis Sent Text Messages In Character As Abe Lincoln

div.div: Apple and Apple Corps, the Beatles’ holding company and owner of the band’s record label, settled their dispute over the iconic apple logo back in 2007, but they’re only just now putting the finishing touches on it.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XZDNQL&via=Digg&text=Beatles’ Apple Now Apple’s Apple

div.div: The structure is loaded with some fancy chance driven software causing the light patterns to respond to their environment in order to create a visual marvel.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y0bFwO&via=Digg&text=Buckyball Lights Up Park

div.a: Putin: Pussy Riot Got What They Deserved

div.div: President Vladimir Putin flatly rejected on Thursday Western criticism of the imprisonment of the Pussy Riot punk protest band, saying its three female members deserved their fate because they threatened the moral foundations of Russia.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VrCyGL&via=Digg&text=Putin: Pussy Riot Got What They Deserved

div.a: Music More Sexually Arousing Than Touch

div.div: Who would have guessed the most arousing music to play during sex is the soundtrack to the hit '80s movie "Dirty Dancing."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TBd9ic&via=Digg&text=Music More Sexually Arousing Than Touch
